subject: Economics
title: Deglobalization: Is the World Pulling Apart?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Deglobalization: Is the World Pulling Apart? usable.

hook.text: Brexit. US-China trade war. COVID supply chain crises.

buildup.text: Trade as a share of global GDP peaked in 2008 and has stalled since. Cross-border investment is declining.

discovery.text: Countries are 'friendshoring' â€” moving supply chains to political allies rather than cheapest producers.

twist.text: While goods trade slows, digital trade is exploding. Data flows grew 148x since 2005.

climax.text: Deglobalization isn't a return to isolation.

punchline.text: Globalization isn't ending. It's just choosing sides.

quiz.question: What is 'friendshoring'?
options: Relocating supply chains to politically allied countries rather than wherever costs are lowest
